pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.2: At that time a brahmin had prepared a milk drink for the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.3: The monks drank the milk making a slurping sound.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.4: A monk who was previously an entertainer made a joke of it, saying,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.5: “It’s as if the whole sangha were cooled.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.6: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.7: “How can a monk joke about the Sangha?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.8: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.11: “… Foolish man, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.12: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.14: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.15: “Monks, you should not joke about the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.16: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.17: After rebuking that monk in many ways for being difficult to support … the Buddha said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.18: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.19.1: ‘“I will not slurp while eating,” this is how you should train.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.20: One should not slurp while eating.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.21: If a monk, out of disrespect, slurps while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.24: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.25: The first training rule is finished.
